content_1: The Guangdong provincial health authority has confirmed the presence of H7N9 in China’s southern province which borders Hong Kong. Guangdong health authorities collected 70 samples from 13 live poultry markets in Shenzhen, and three samples from two different markets have tested positive for the bird flu H7N9. The authorities have been warning the general public to be aware of H7N9 transmission risks, but the markets remain open at the present time. Efforts have been made to tighten prevention measures after three new cases were recently confirmed in Hong Kong and east China’s Zhejiang Province. The Chinese mainland has now had a total of 140 human H7N9 cases reported, and out of that total, 53 have died. Avian Influenza in Humans
